Is there something getting in the way of the socket communication?

This exception indicates that more than 10 seconds is passing for the

Yes, this happens for any ant build.
However, other java processes are having socket connection problems, so I'm
starting to think it might be a FC4/jdk issue rather than eclipse.
I'll see if can track it down some more.

This turned out to be a FC4/jdk 1.4 issue.
Disabling IPV6 in FC4 solved the problem:

/etc/modprobe.conf:
alias net-pf-10 off

I get this problem inconsistently on my plaform.
It happens on every 3rd or 4th run if (I strongly suspect after observing for a while now) Java is gc-ing or xp is swapping - time is lost and "accept times out" (We have browser,fire wall,virus checker and other bits also running)

Loosing the output is very frustrating. Is it possible to change this time out value via some config file in 3.2M4? Can we increase it to 30-60 or "preference set" it in future releases ? Please help.

Thank you for the report.
Reopening to consider exposing the timeout as a preference.

Timeout exposed as a preference on the Ant preference page.

Changes to
AntUIPreferenceInitializer to set the preference default value
IAntUIPreferenceConstants to define the preference
RemoteAntBuildListener: removed debug code and uses the preference value for the socket timeout
AntPreferencePage: added the integer field editor for the preference
AntPreferenceMessages files: nlsing for the preference page

verified.
Updated error message to include upper bound as well as the lower bound of timeout preference. If you entered a timeout greater that Integer.MaxInt it told you that timeout had to be greater than 10000.

hmmm...I am not sure I like the error message. I agree it needed tweaking but showing the 2 billion plus milliseconds looks weird. I will see how I feel tomorrow.

I also bumped up the default to 20 seconds (same as the debug launch timeout)
I agree. I just wasn't sure what a reasonable upper bound for the timeout was. MaxInt is too long.
Upper bound of 5 min should be sufficient. If it can't make it in that time then we need a machine upgrade ( definitely in our case ) or there is some other problem that needs investigation.

I think if we double it and move to 10 mins no one should complain.

The debug preference pages have the same issue.
